queries.description: When storage durations are not compatible between assigned pointers it can lead to referring to objects outside of their lifetime, which is undefined behaviour.
queries.name: Declare objects with appropriate storage durations

implementation_scope.description: The rule checks specifically for pointers to objects with automatic storage duration with respect to the following cases: returned by functions, assigned to function output parameters and assigned to static storage duration variables.

DCL30-C.title: Declare objects with appropriate storage durations
